website_summaries.verdict: The Canon Pixma iP4500 is a bit too expensive for basic home users, but those who do a bit more printing than the occasional e-mail and map will be happy with its speed and quality.
cons: No preview LCD or memory card slots

customer_reviews.title: So far, seems to be a good choice
customer_reviews.text: Just received the printer today. I did not need an all-in-one, so I went with the 4600. Setup was a bit slow, but I was very careful handling the ink etc and making sure I knew what I was doing. My intial results are pleasing. I am very pleased with the photo printing. I printed only one text document, but it seems good enough for my needs under the standard setting. Printing for me is reasonably quiet. Obviously, I don't know if it is an ink hog. Prices for inks are inflated for most manufacturers, which is a drag. I would be nice if ink prices were more reasonable. So far, a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Four years of good printing, so far
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for both everyday office printing and for test prints of photos. The quality is surprisingly good for this price range. Have not had any problems with it. I do buy generic cartridges for the ink and they seem to work fine. No clogs, no excessive need to clean the heads, etc. A good deal for amateur photographers. One downside is that the regular paper tray is REALLY small! Constantly have to load paper in it. Not meant for major print jobs.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: You won't go wrong!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this printer for 4 months now, and am very pleased with the performance. The photo print quality is stunning, and the text printing is as good as any laser jet. I really appreciate the separate ink tanks; saves money in the long run. And, the two sided printing has already saved me at least a ream of paper. My only complaint is that it does take a while to "warm-up" when first turned on. But, this is only a minor inconvenience. I highly recommend this printer to anyone. Good Job Canon!!
customer_reviews.author: Vulnavia Phibes

customer_reviews.title: Can Never Find the Paper Source
customer_reviews.text: I have had several Canon printers in the past (PIXMA iP8500 and i960) and have loved them. The iP4600 prints photos well, but not up to the level of either of my other printers. It prints documents well. The PROBLEM is the paper source. It constantly says the cassette is out of paper when it is not. It sometimes pulls photopaper out of the rear tray when there is plenty of paper in the cassette, wasting photopaper. I am about ready to return it. When it prints, it is fine. But checking the printer every few minutes becomes frustrating. I have been pleased with the ink usage as opposed to other reviewers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No support for macOS Sierra
customer_reviews.text: No drivers for macOS Sierra, 10.12. Becomes a doorstop if you upgrade or buy a new Mac.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Costantinidis

customer_reviews.title: Too bad this printer is out of production
customer_reviews.text: Too bad this printer is out of production; we have relied on this for everything! So, when the old one died after many years of use we had to find another ('cause we found Canon ink cartridges at 80% off and we have over 40 cartridges). Thank goodness we found one; unfortunately it cost us over twice as much as original. But it was much cheaper than what others were sell 'em at.
customer_reviews.author: T. Laynor

customer_reviews.title: Canon iP4600 is junk
customer_reviews.text: This printer is a piece of garbage. The paper feed is very troublesome. It misfeeds or fails to "grab" the paper over 70% of the time. It doesn't matter which tray or the type of paper I use. The ink is overpriced. Occasionally I do get a nice photo out of the darn thing but its always a struggle. Print documents are nice if I can get the paper to feed properly. Do not buy this printer! Based on my experience here I would not dare to try any other Canon printers either.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Great All Round Printer
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want an all-in-one printer as I already have a Canon scanner that I like. Using Canon photo paper, the photo prints of my digital files look fantastic, and it does a great job with documents and Google directions. The software isn't intrusive on my system, and is really easy to use. This printer was exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: so-so
customer_reviews.text: Pluses: Lots of cover plates to keep dust down. Photos print very quickly, quality of photo is excellent. Minuses: Type print quality is substandard,not sharp. With cover plates, you have to remember to unlatch them to get the printer to start printing. Does go through ink pretty quickly. With my Vista computer software, it's very slow to communicate to the printer my request for photo copying.
customer_reviews.author: Kim L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent photo printer
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed with this little printer. Photo-paper printing quality is better than I expected, the drivers actually work reliably on my mac, and quick draft-quality color printing jobs are produced very rapidly. The only drawback I've come up against is the small paper tray; there isn't much capacity there which can be a pain if you are printing more than a couple of pages at a time.
customer_reviews.author: D. Marks

customer_reviews.title: Prints Disks!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just search eBay for the buy that sells the adapters so your printer can print disks. It is cheap & VERY EASY. Also take a look at inkjethelper dot com (you get the idea) Google it if nothing else. They explain everything & are very helpful. My 33, ip4200 & my son's ip4700 or some such have been done & now print disks just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Has Longevity
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the ip4600 from amazon.com in July, 2009. It has continually worked great. I can print photos on matte photo paper(my preference) with the regular ink. I always buy Canon Printers because their color is the best and they have longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Glorym

customer_reviews.title: Sue's Canon IP4600
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Canon Pixma. I use a lot of graphics and photos to create colorful and exciting scrapbook pages, greetings cards, tags, and flyers. I use several graphics programs to devise sample designs for making beautiful glass lamps and shades. I want the colors to be vivid and true in all my work. This printer delivers big time! My new 4600 is even faster than my old Pixma for color as well as b&w. All the previous and a terrific price! What else can I say? I'm a happy camper!
customer_reviews.author: Sue A. Sipes

customer_reviews.title: If You Print Address Labels, You Can Forget this Printer
customer_reviews.text: I have to send an order out like RIGHT NOW. I've been messing around with the software settings for the last 20 minutes trying to get address labels to load from the top/back tray. In older Pixma's there were control buttons to switch the paper source, now not. I deselected the automatic determination, but the bottom line is that if you are feeding any sort of 8-1/2 X 11 paper, apparently it's impossible to print from that tray. The only option is "plain paper" which tells it to print from the cassette. Even when telling it to print from the rear tray. I hate this thing. And now my order will be DAYS LATE.
customer_reviews.author: S. Turell

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: Love this printer so far. It takes all different types of paper, which my HP refused to do, only working with HP papers that didn't always suit my purposes. The clarity of the printing is great. It's a little slow to wind up, but once it starts printing, it's really quick. A nice printer for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Hillcrest

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good general purpose printer. Nothing to rave about. It works. Seems to eat ink but they all do that.
customer_reviews.author: Walt N

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have one and bought another, I'm a fool, can't anyone make a descent printer
customer_reviews.author: Peter De Mattia

customer_reviews.title: expensive ink
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer to replace a Canon PIXMA IP5000 which had some print head issues after 5 years. It was inexpensive compared to a new IP5000. The box does not include a printer cable but set up and installation was automatic and easy. My only complaint is the cost of ink which I discovered when trying to buy replacement cartridges. The problem is this printer uses pigmented ink which is very expensive, instead of dye based ink. The printouts using pigmented ink are supposed last longer but we were replacing a home printer and were not in need of the better/more expensive ink. All my fault, the printer itself is fine.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rowley

customer_reviews.title: Speed, duplexing, quality abound
customer_reviews.text: Replaced another Canon printer that just wore out after many years of use. I love the duplexing feature of the Canon printers because it saves me so much money on paper. The individual ink tanks also are a money saver. No problems at all. Works like a charm. Not too noisy and it sits right by my head up on a shelf. I use it mostly for work, reports, etc. not for photo's - I haven't tried that yet. I only wish I could find compatiable ink tanks or a way to use ink refill bottles to do it myself and save even more money.
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: Pleased but...
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived as promised and I took it out of the box for installation. All went well until I went to print. I had difficulty finding where to set the default paper feed. Finally got it to fee correctly and print some pictures. Outstanding quality. Very pleased with result.
customer_reviews.author: Digital Hank

customer_reviews.title: Replacement printer
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint about this printer is that it doesn't print on CD and DVD blank disks. Otherwise, this is a truly great low-cost photo printer in the great tradition of Canon printers. It replaced an Epson printer, and I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: William J. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful! Vivid pics!
customer_reviews.text: This is truely a great printer! The colors are so vivid and beauitful looking. It makes all my pictures stand out much better than my old Epson photo printer could have ever of dreamed! It is very much worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: We love it. Have had for several years now
customer_reviews.text: We love it. Have had for several years now. I like that is has separate compartments for each color.
customer_reviews.author: B. Eno

customer_reviews.title: Canon iP4600 Printer
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am satisfied with the printer for both general printing and photos. The printing speed for photos is good. Two sided printing is somewhat slower than I would like. The delay for drying before printing the opposite side seems too long. After a interval of no printing there is too long a delay before the first page prints while some kind of mechanical activity goes on in the printer. I would rate it as a good value purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Al C

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST OF THE BEST
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS A PRINTER THAT IS ULTRA QUIET. THE DEPLEX FEATURE IS GREAT NOT ONLY SAVES PAPER BUT REDUCES THE VOLUME OF PAPER WHEN PRINTING FOR THE FILE . USES THE NORMAL AMOUT OF INK, OR PERHAPS LESS. EASY TO SET UP. LOOKS VERY SLEEK. AND VERY EASY TO USE. THE PRINTER IS BACK BY CANON'S TECH SUPPORT WHICH IS THE BEST OF ANY PRODUCT AND COMPANY. TO PURCHASE THIS PRINTER YOU ARE MAKING THE VERY BEST CHOICE. I HIGH RECOMENDLY THIS PRINTER TO ALL.
customer_reviews.author: Charles P. Cathcart

customer_reviews.title: Pay back for joy
customer_reviews.text: I write this review to payback the sheer enjoyment this printer has provided.It is not the fastest but for ink sparing use,ease of use,and quality I rate it 5 star. My daughter says, "the pictures of people look better than they do in real life". I rarely write a review but I have been so pleased with this product that after a years use I want to repay Cannon for an all too uncommon experience
customer_reviews.author: THE GUNSMITH

customer_reviews.title: Best Photo's I've ever printed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this from Amazon a few months ago and I must say that the photo quality is perfect. My pictures print out better then if I take them to a store to be printed. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: B. Gattis

customer_reviews.title: Good printer.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality for the price. Only downside is that there is no auto power on and off feature, like older model.
customer_reviews.author: Spicy

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: I have only used the printer a few weeks. It is fast and produces good clear printed pages both black & white and color. I am very happy so far and would buy this model again.
customer_reviews.author: Owen R. Kaufman

customer_reviews.title: iP4600
customer_reviews.text: An excellent printer unfortunately endowed with the sleaziness common to printer manufacturers and razor makers. Changing the cartridges for no reason that I can see. I had a fairly extensive selection of spare inks which are now of no use as the new cartridges are physically smaller. I will think long and hard whether or not to buy canon again.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Magnus

customer_reviews.title: CANON SUPPORT "Buy Another One."
customer_reviews.text: I had this printer for a year and a half and while yes it did drink ink, it produced high quality prints...BUT, this morning it would not turn on. I tried everything plug, unplug, use different outlets, unplug, plug, downloaded new drivers, then I called customer support for Canon. Their support, "You'd be better off buying a new printer. Would you like me to connect you to our Canon Loyalty Support Program where they can set you up with a brand new printer?" Seriously! This is is their support! Done with Canon!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Canon Pixma iP4600
customer_reviews.text: I find this printer very easy to use. My only fault with it is that I have had several paper jams which I rarely had with an earlier version of a Canon Printer. It prints very well whether for just black and white on plain paper or for photos. It does use a lot of ink but the quality it prints is very good. I highly reccomend it.
customer_reviews.author: Janice D. Gower

customer_reviews.title: IP4600 purchase
customer_reviews.text: This printer does all I need and is quite fast. Photos print fast and clear. Text prints fast. The initial warm up period is a bit long, but bearable and worth it. A great quality value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Bevacqua

customer_reviews.title: Good basic printer
customer_reviews.text: The color cartridges last a long time for us. The printer does pretty much whatever we need/want to do. I have printed wine labels, t-shirt iron ons, photos, and just everyday printing needs.
customer_reviews.author: Suzique

customer_reviews.title: Good printer
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have used this printer for many years. Still puts out quality prints. This would be an excellent choice for a computer
customer_reviews.author: A. Amoroso

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this printer! It is the fifth printer I've owned, and the fourth Canon (in a row), and none of them came even close to the photo print quality of this one. Thank you Canon!
customer_reviews.author: William C. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: The printer does a good job on both printing and photos and is an excellent value at $90 with free shipping.
customer_reviews.author: TC Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Good printer
customer_reviews.text: It's a printer it does its job, being still expensive, welcome to rip off world but nobody is any different
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as iP4000
customer_reviews.text: I cannot tell the difference between iP4600 and iP4000 in terms of quality of print. However I can see that the ink cartridges are smaller and contain less ink for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: N. Kydonieus

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have had very good luck with Canon Pixma printers. This model has been a disappointment. Two things bother me about this printer: 1) paper fed from the bottom tray jams all of the time and 2)it takes forever for the first page to print. The print quality is very good, but it is so very annoying to wait a minute or two for the first page to print.
customer_reviews.author: ReportMonkey

customer_reviews.title: Would be 5 Star
customer_reviews.text: This prints Great Photo's Borderless too! Drawback is that the ink seams smaller then the older model ip5000. And it don't automatically shut off.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Canon iP4600 inkjet photo printer
customer_reviews.text: The printer arrived promptly and was as advertised. I am satisfied and would recommend the printer to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Allen R. Sundell

customer_reviews.title: We have a wordwide depression and they're RAISING their prices 15 bux
customer_reviews.text: You have GOT to be kidding - they load the cartridges with chips so aftermarket can't counter the ridiculous prices of their replacement ink, AND in the face of a collapsing worldwide economy they RAISE prices - FIFTEEN BUX!!!!? I love Canon stuff, everybody, and I was going to buy this thing tonight. But here and now somebody else gets my business. Go ahead and fry, Canon. I'm gone.
customer_reviews.author: Jer2

product_meta.title: Canon iP4600 Inkjet Photo Printer (2909B002)
product_meta.description:
Canon iP4600 inkjet photo printer is premium photo printer with individual ink tanks and built-in auto duplex.

AMAZON.COM
Manufacturer Product Description Photo lab-quality 4 x 6 inch borderless prints in 20 seconds? Yes, you can do that, and much more. The new 5-color ink system – four dye-based inks and a pigment-based black ink – produces vivid colors and bold, black text. And Canon’s patented print head technology creates beautiful, long-lasting photos with resolution up to 9600 x 2400 color dpi. 

 

PIXMA iP4600 Photo Printer:

 * 9600 x 2400 color dpi resolution. 
 * Print right from your infrared-enabled mobile camera phone! 
 * Auto Photo Fix - optimizes your images for such factors as skin tone, white balance and brightness, and makes red-eye corrections. 







This stylish home printer delivers a resolution of up to 9600 x 2400 color dpi, with droplets as small as 1 picoliter for spectacular photo detail and document clarity. View larger You can also print photos directly from a compatible digital camera or camera phone – no computer required! The two paper trays let you store both photo and plain paper, allowing you to automatically print 2-sided and save on costs. Quick Start lets you power up in seconds, and the Auto Photo Fix feature corrects red-eye and enhances your images. Long-Lasting Beautiful Photos
ChromaLife100+ system delivers vibrant photos that last up to 300 years. 

Five High-Performance Ink Tanks
The 5-color ink system consists of four dye-based inks plus a pigment-based black ink, producing exceptional photos and crisp, laser-quality text. You replace only the color that runs out, rather than a multi-color tank containing unused ink. 



Spectacular Resolution
This stylish home printer delivers a resolution of up to 9600 x 2400 color dpi, with droplets as small as 1 picoliter for spectacular photo detail and document clarity. And you won’t have to wait long for your exceptional photos. A beautiful borderless 4 x 6 inch photo takes approx. 20 seconds. 

Auto Duplex Print
The two paper trays let you store photo paper in one, plain paper in the other – so you’re always ready to print either photos or documents. Plus, you can automatically print 2-sided to save paper. 

 

Automatic Image Optimization
Just one of the features on the included Easy-PhotoPrint EX software – Auto Photo Fix - optimizes your images for such factors as skin tone, white balance and brightness, and makes red-eye corrections.



Just Snap and Print 
Print right from your infrared-enabled mobile camera phone!

PictBridge
Powering up your printer is now faster than ever. After pressing the power button, you can begin inputting commands in approximately 2 seconds. Full operation is even enabled in a shorter time now too.
feature_bullets: Photo lab quality borderless 4 by 5 inch photo in approximately 20 seconds
ChromaLife100 system delivers vibrant photos that last up to 300 years
Maximum 9600 by 2400 dpi with microscopic droplets as small as 1 picoliter using FINE technology
"Easy-PhotoPrint EX" software with enhanced "Auto Photo Fix" easily removes red eye

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars105 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
